title: I'll name that tune in.... two?
content:
OK, I’ve been saddled with this logo, and have to work with these letterforms... as the client “likes” them...

Does anyone have the heart to tell me what this is... I think the ’h’ has been cropped on the left and top just to make it even harder...

Thanks for any ideas!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043243/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_36.jpg) | 4.3 KB |

 [‹ Certificate Type ID please](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043243/http:/typophile.com/node/50648 "Go to previous forum topic") [ummmm.... what is this typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043243/http:/typophile.com/node/50619 "Go to next forum topic")
author: buddhaboy

comments.content:
It could be a butchered ’Gulliver’ by Gerard Unger.

Your client is an idiot.

Nick Cooke

I’ll be sure to pass that along :)

I can’t see the similarity... the h is unique... I’m sure I’ve seen this kind of form somewhere, but I’m buggered if I can remember where.

Of course the h is unique - it has been butchered!

Nick Cooke
